thread.title: Columbus Blue Jackets Fans Frustrated with Season; Hope for Turn Around
thread.title_full: Columbus Blue Jackets Fans Frustrated with Season; Hope for Turn Around

title: Columbus Blue Jackets Fans Frustrated with Season; Hope for Turn Around
text:
Columbus Blue Jackets Fans Frustrated with Season; Hope for Turn Around By Meghan Matthews Wednesday October 21, 2015 6:56 PM COLUMBUS, Ohio - 
Fans watched the swift change in Blue Jackets leadership Wednesday after the announcement of the firing of head coach Todd Richards . 
Many fans are hoping his replacement, John Tortorella, will have an even swifter turnaround for the struggling hockey franchise. 
Hockey fans tell 10TV they aren’t sure where they stand on this coaching decision, but a change was needed. 
In a bar where hockey die-hard fans wear their emotions on their sleeves, frustration over the Blue Jackets season is easy to find. 
"With all the hype we've had, we expected a lot more,” Michael Darr said. 
"As a die-hard 5th liner, it's been rough,” Matt Pfeffer said. 
One loss after another has been hard to watch for fans on the ice and on the screens at the R Bar. 
"Living down here in the Arena District it's, people are starting to lose some faith,” Lara Woods said. 
Mike Darr caught the last Blue Jackets game coached by Todd Richards Tuesday night. He says the crowd turned on the team and Richards. The move to fire Richards did not surprise Darr. 
"The fans are definitely frustrated. They are booing out there. It's not good that that happens, but you know the fans, it's a way for them to hear their voice,” the R Bar Owner said. 
Hockey fans watched on TVs at the R Bar while the Blue Jackets new head coach John Tortorella made his first appearance in Columbus. 
"It'll be interesting to see Thursday night's game with Torts behind the bench. I think a lot of people will come out to watch that,” Darr said. 
Some fans say time will tell if Tortorella is the right guy for the job, but a change is needed and there’s still hope for their team. 
"The Jackets have started off with a losing record for several years and have bounced back to the playoffs, so there's always hope,” Woods said. 
“Even if we're down, it's just seven battles. We have 75 battles to go. We can ride the ship still,” Pfeffer said. 
Fans tell 10TV they still have hopes the Blue Jackets will make the playoffs. Others are curious to see how the team’s next game will play out against Minnesota Wild. ©2015 by 10TV.com.
